title: The Russian Technocrat Who Helps Enable Putin and Manage the Ukraine War
summary: For three years, Sergei V. Kiriyenko has handled the political aspects of the war in Ukraine, rising among a cadre of skilled managers who oversee the sprawling Russian state.

title: Takeaways From The Times’s Reporting on Putin’s Powerful Aide
summary: Showing an uncanny ability to adapt to circumstances, Sergei V. Kiriyenko has turned himself into a key engineer of President Vladimir V. Putin’s autocratic machine.

title: Dmitri Kozak Was a Key Putin Aide. He Lost Power When He Balked at the Ukraine War.
summary: Dmitri N. Kozak, who has said privately that the invasion was a mistake, has lost power to another senior Putin ally, Sergei V. Kiriyenko, who has embraced the military action.

title: Netanyahu Doubles Down on Gaza Offensive After Global Backlash
summary: This is not the first time the Israeli prime minister has called for one final military drive to dismantle Hamas and end the war.

title: How Starmer, Macron and Merz Tried to Halt the War in Gaza
summary: Images of starving children and Israel’s planned expansion of settlements spurred Britain, France and Germany to a tougher stance. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was undeterred.

title: Why Young Americans Dread Turning 26: Health Insurance Chaos
summary: Young adults without jobs that provide insurance find that their options are limited and expensive. The problem is about to get worse.

title: A Guide to Finding Insurance at 26
summary: It’s a difficult rite of passage for young adults without job-based insurance. Here are some tips for getting started.

title: Dr. Phil’s Road From Oprah to ICE Raids
summary: The daytime TV fixture seems to have taken a rightward turn. But don’t call it politics.

title: What Happened When Mark Zuckerberg Moved In Next Door
summary: The billionaire has bought at least 11 properties in Palo Alto, Calif., creating a compound for his family, a private school for his children — and headaches for his neighbors.

title: Zuckerberg’s Compound Had Something That Violated City Code: A Private School
summary: The school, called BBS, enrolled 14 children in kindergarten through fourth grade and employed three full-time teachers and other staff members.

title: Trump’s Cartel Order Revives ‘Bitter’ Memories in Latin America
summary: The decision triggers fears that the U.S. might return to a pattern of military interference in the region that dates to the Monroe Doctrine.

title: Can AriZona’s 99-Cent Iced Tea Survive Trump’s Tariffs?
summary: The price has been AriZona’s calling card for nearly three decades. A 50 percent tariff on imported aluminum may change that.

title: Environmental Leader Laments Loss of Bipartisanship on Climate Issues
summary: Gene Karpinski, who retired from leading the League of Conservation Voters after two decades, said the group that once backed G.O.P. candidates now finds it difficult to do so.

title: Cannabis Poisonings Are Rising, Mostly Among Kids
summary: As products like weed gummies proliferate, more children and teens are suffering symptoms including seizures and life-threatening breathing problems.

title: Trump Raids Help Stir a Political Reversal for Karen Bass
summary: The mayor of Los Angeles has emerged as a leading voice of the city’s resistance to the Trump administration after facing criticism for her handling of the wildfires.

title: C.D.C. Workers Say Shooting Manifests Worst Fears About Anger Among Public
summary: Employees expressed horror at a shooting at the agency’s headquarters, and some said they viewed it as part of a pattern of threats and assaults on health workers.

title: What We Know About the C.D.C. Shooting in Atlanta
summary: A gunman who believed the Covid-19 vaccine had made him ill fired at the agency’s Atlanta offices, killing a police officer and rattling the public health community.

title: Computer Science Grads Struggle to Find Jobs in the A.I. Age
summary: As companies like Amazon and Microsoft lay off workers and embrace A.I. coding tools, computer science graduates say they’re struggling to land tech jobs.

title: The Hidden Trauma of Jury Duty
summary: People who serve on disturbing cases can suffer mental health effects for years after a trial ends.

title: If You Fly Economy, You’re Paying for Someone Else to Fly Private
summary: The Times editorial board argues that Congress must change the Federal Aviation Administration’s funding structure.

title: ‘Acute, Sustained, Profound and Abiding Rage’: Canada Finds Its Voice
summary: America’s withdrawal from the global order is forcing former allies to rethink their identities.

title: Jury Duties
summary: Some jurors experience mental health effects years after a trial ends.

title: Heavy Rains in Wisconsin Lead to Flooding and Early Closure of State Fair
summary: Record-setting rainfall caused intense flooding in and around the Milwaukee area starting on Saturday night.

title: Terry Reid, Rock Singer Known as ‘Superlungs,’ Dies at 75
summary: He missed his chance to be Led Zeppelin’s lead vocalist, but his solo work — and his otherworldly voice — drew raves from Aretha Franklin and others.

title: Xi Looks to Tighten Grip After Scandals Shake China’s Military Elite
summary: The Chinese leader’s crackdown on military corruption reveals how deep his concerns run, not only about battlefield readiness, but about political survival, as well.

title: The 6 Social Security Myths That Won’t Go Away
summary: The program gave birth to the idea of retirement and covers nearly all Americans — but now it faces major financial and customer service challenges.
